block.p: Julie Ruth Schoenberg and A. J. Jacobs were married yesterday in East Hampton, N.Y., at the home of the bridegroom's maternal grandparents, Ann Kheel and Theodore W. Kheel, the labor mediator. Judge Michael B. Mukasey, chief judge of the Federal District Court in Manhattan, performed the ceremony.
The bride and bridegroom, both 32, work at Entertainment Weekly magazine in Manhattan. She is the business development director, and he is a senior editor.

Julie Ruth Schoenberg and A. J. Jacobs were married yesterday in East Hampton, N.Y., at the home of the bridegroom's maternal grandparents, Ann Kheel and Theodore W. Kheel, the labor mediator. Judge Michael B. Mukasey, chief judge of the Federal District Court in Manhattan, performed the ceremony.
The bride and bridegroom, both 32, work at Entertainment Weekly magazine in Manhattan. She is the business development director, and he is a senior editor.

Mrs. Jacobs graduated from Dickinson College in Carlisle, Pa. She is the daughter of Dr. Lawrence J. Schoenberg of Longboat Key, Fla., and Barbara Schoenberg Harrison of Berkeley Heights, N.J., and the stepdaughter of Barbara Brizdle and of David Harrison. The bride's father, who is retired, is the founder and former chief executive of AGS, a computer software company, which was sold to Nynex. Her mother, a psychotherapist, practices in Berkeley Heights.

Mr. Jacobs is the author of three books of humor and has written episodes for ''Celebrity Deathmatch,'' an animated series on MTV. He graduated magna cum laude from Brown University. He is the son of Ellen Kheel Jacobs and Arnold S. Jacobs Sr. of New York. The bridegroom's mother, the chairwoman of volunteers at the New York Public Library, is also a goldsmith and jewelry designer. His father is a partner in Proskauer Rose, the New York law firm, and has written 19 books on securities law.
